00039 struct ID;
00040 struct Main;

00046 
00047 /* **** DAG relation types *** */
00048 
00049     /* scene link to object */
00050 #define DAG_RL_SCENE        (1<<0)
00051     /* object link to data */
00052 #define DAG_RL_DATA         (1<<1)
00053 
00054     /* object changes object (parent, track, constraints) */
00055 #define DAG_RL_OB_OB        (1<<2)
00056     /* object changes obdata (hooks, constraints) */
00057 #define DAG_RL_OB_DATA      (1<<3)
00058     /* data changes object (vertex parent) */
00059 #define DAG_RL_DATA_OB      (1<<4)
00060     /* data changes data (deformers) */
00061 #define DAG_RL_DATA_DATA    (1<<5)
00062 
00063 #define DAG_NO_RELATION     (1<<6)
00064 
00065 #define DAG_RL_ALL_BUT_DATA (DAG_RL_SCENE|DAG_RL_OB_OB|DAG_RL_OB_DATA|DAG_RL_DATA_OB|DAG_RL_DATA_DATA)
00066 #define DAG_RL_ALL          (DAG_RL_ALL_BUT_DATA|DAG_RL_DATA)
00067 
00068 
00069 typedef void (*graph_action_func)(void * ob, void **data);
00070 
00071 // queues are returned by all BFS & DFS queries
00072 // opaque type
00073 void    *pop_ob_queue(struct DagNodeQueue *queue);
00074 int     queue_count(struct DagNodeQueue *queue);
00075 void    queue_delete(struct DagNodeQueue *queue);
00076 
00077 // queries
00078 struct DagForest    *build_dag(struct Main *bmain, struct Scene *sce, short mask);
00079 void                free_forest(struct DagForest *Dag);
00080 
00081 // note :
00082 // the meanings of the 2 returning values is a bit different :
00083 // BFS return 1 for cross-edges and back-edges. the latter are considered harmfull, not the former
00084 // DFS return 1 only for back-edges
00085 int pre_and_post_BFS(struct DagForest *dag, short mask, graph_action_func pre_func, graph_action_func post_func, void **data);
00086 int pre_and_post_DFS(struct DagForest *dag, short mask, graph_action_func pre_func, graph_action_func post_func, void **data);
00087 
00088 int pre_and_post_source_BFS(struct DagForest *dag, short mask, struct DagNode *source, graph_action_func pre_func, graph_action_func post_func, void **data);
00089 int pre_and_post_source_DFS(struct DagForest *dag, short mask, struct DagNode *source, graph_action_func pre_func, graph_action_func post_func, void **data);
00090 
00091 struct DagNodeQueue *get_obparents(struct DagForest *dag, void *ob); 
00092 struct DagNodeQueue *get_first_ancestors(struct DagForest   *dag, void *ob); 
00093 struct DagNodeQueue *get_all_childs(struct DagForest    *dag, void *ob); //
00094 short       are_obs_related(struct DagForest    *dag, void *ob1, void *ob2);
00095 int                 is_acyclic(struct DagForest *dag); //

00098 /* ********** API *************** */
00099 /* Note that the DAG never executes changes in Objects, only sets flags in Objects */
00100 
00101         /* (re)-create dependency graph for scene */
00102 void    DAG_scene_sort(struct Main *bmain, struct Scene *sce);
00103 
00104         /* flag all objects that need recalc because they're animated */
00105 void    DAG_scene_update_flags(struct Main *bmain, struct Scene *sce, unsigned int lay, const short do_time);
00106         /* flushes all recalc flags in objects down the dependency tree */
00107 void    DAG_scene_flush_update(struct Main *bmain, struct Scene *sce, unsigned int lay, const short do_time);
00108         /* tag objects for update on file load */
00109 void    DAG_on_visible_update(struct Main *bmain, const short do_time);
00110 
00111         /* when setting manual RECALC flags, call this afterwards */
00112 void    DAG_ids_flush_update(struct Main *bmain, int time);
00113 
00114         /* tag datablock to get updated for the next redraw */
00115 void    DAG_id_tag_update(struct ID *id, short flag);
00116         /* flush all tagged updates */
00117 void    DAG_ids_flush_tagged(struct Main *bmain);
00118         /* check and clear ID recalc flags */
00119 void    DAG_ids_check_recalc(struct Main *bmain, struct Scene *scene, int time);
00120 void    DAG_ids_clear_recalc(struct Main *bmain);
00121         /* test if any of this id type is tagged for update */
00122 void    DAG_id_type_tag(struct Main *bmain, short idtype);
00123 int     DAG_id_type_tagged(struct Main *bmain, short idtype);
00124 
00125         /* (re)-create dependency graph for armature pose */
00126 void    DAG_pose_sort(struct Object *ob);
00127 
00128         /* callback for editors module to do updates */
00129 void    DAG_editors_update_cb(void (*id_func)(struct Main *bmain, struct ID *id),
00130                               void (*scene_func)(struct Main *bmain, struct Scene *scene, int updated));
00131
